page.title: 02GRID REFERENCE O396O141
page.content: A main east-west B class road links Chitterne to the market town of Warminster eight miles to the west, and to Shrewton, a larger village to the east. An unclassified road joins villages from north to south. Electricity and telephone lines are mounted on pylons and posts along the valley from Codford. Mains water was brought into Chitterne only in 1969 and a few dwellings remain on private supplies from good wells. There is no mains drainage. The County Council provides a mobile library fortnightly, rubbish collection weekly; verges are cut twice in summer and roads are salted and gritted in freezing weather. There is no street lighting either in the village of Chitterne or in the connecting roads.
